verses.verse: To the chief <S%H5329>Musician<s%> upon <S%H5155>Nehiloth<s%>, A <S%H4210>Psalm<s%> of <S%H1732>David<s%>. Give <S%H238>ear<s%> to my <S%H561>words<s%>, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, <S%H995>consider<s%> my <S%H1901>meditation<s%>.
<S%H7181>Hearken<s%> unto the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of my <S%H7773>cry<s%>, my <S%H4428>King<s%>, and my <S%H430>God<s%>: for unto thee will I <S%H6419>pray<s%>.

My <S%H6963>voice<s%> shalt thou <S%H8085>hear<s%> in the <S%H1242>morning<s%>, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>; in the <S%H1242>morning<s%> will I <S%H6186>direct<s%> my prayer unto thee, and will look <S%H6822>up<s%>.
For thou art not a <S%H410>God<s%> that hath <S%H2655>pleasure<s%> in <S%H7562>wickedness<s%>: neither shall <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H1481>dwell<s%> with thee.
The <S%H1984>foolish<s%> shall not <S%H3320>stand<s%> in thy <S%H5869>sight<s%>: thou <S%H8130>hatest<s%> all <S%H6466>workers<s%> of <S%H205>iniquity<s%>. in: Heb. before thine eyes

Thou shalt <S%H6>destroy<s%> them that <S%H1696>speak<s%> <S%H3577>leasing<s%>: the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> will <S%H8581>abhor<s%> the <S%H1818>bloody<s%> and <S%H4820>deceitful<s%> <S%H376>man<s%>. bloody: Heb. man of bloods and deceit

But as for me, I will <S%H935>come<s%> into thy <S%H1004>house<s%> in the <S%H7230>multitude<s%> of thy <S%H2617>mercy<s%>: and in thy <S%H3374>fear<s%> will I <S%H7812>worship<s%> toward thy <S%H6944>holy<s%> <S%H1964>temple<s%>. thy holy: Heb. the temple of thy holiness

<S%H5148>Lead<s%> me, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, in thy <S%H6666>righteousness<s%> because of mine <S%H8324>enemies<s%>; make thy <S%H1870>way<s%> <S%H3474>straight<s%> before my <S%H6440>face<s%>. mine: Heb. those which observe me

For there is no <S%H3559>faithfulness<s%> in their <S%H6310>mouth<s%>; their <S%H7130>inward<s%> part is very <S%H1942>wickedness<s%>; their <S%H1627>throat<s%> is an <S%H6605>open<s%> <S%H6913>sepulchre<s%>; they <S%H2505>flatter<s%> with their <S%H3956>tongue<s%>. faithfulness: or, stedfastness their mouth: Heb. his mouth, that is, the mouth of any of them very: Heb. wickednesses

<S%H816>Destroy<s%> thou them, O <S%H430>God<s%>; let them <S%H5307>fall<s%> by their own <S%H4156>counsels<s%>; cast them <S%H5080>out<s%> in the <S%H7230>multitude<s%> of their <S%H6588>transgressions<s%>; for they have <S%H4784>rebelled<s%> against thee. Destroy: or, Make them guilty by: or, from their counsels

But let all those that put their <S%H2620>trust<s%> in thee <S%H8055>rejoice<s%>: let them <S%H5769>ever<s%> shout for <S%H7442>joy<s%>, because thou <S%H5526>defendest<s%> them: let them also that <S%H157>love<s%> thy <S%H8034>name<s%> be <S%H5970>joyful<s%> in thee. defendest: Heb. coverest over, or, protectest them
For thou, <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, wilt <S%H1288>bless<s%> the <S%H6662>righteous<s%>; with <S%H7522>favour<s%> wilt thou <S%H5849>compass<s%> him as with a <S%H6793>shield<s%>. compass: Heb. crown
